<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/086ae06862077ba228fcae777f2a0b41416c11bb|patch 8.2.2326: build error with +eval feature but without +spell>
patch 8.2.2326: build error with +eval feature but without +spell

Problem:    Build error with +eval feature but without +spell.
Solution:   Adjust #ifdef. (John Marriott)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/75ab91ff3403e725a79ac9c7351b78e9aff71d67|patch 8.2.2325: Vim9: crash if map() changes the item type>
patch 8.2.2325: Vim9: crash if map() changes the item type

Problem:    Vim9: crash if map() changes the item type.
Solution:   Check that the item type is still OK. (closes #7652)
            Fix problem with mapnew() on range list.

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/6f02b00bb0958f70bc15534e115b4c6dadff0e06|patch 8.2.2324: not easy to get mark en cursor posotion by character …>
patch 8.2.2324: not easy to get mark en cursor posotion by character count

Problem:    Not easy to get mark en cursor posotion by character count.
Solution:   Add functions that use character index. (Yegappan Lakshmanan,
            closes #7648)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2324: not easy to get mark en cursor posotion by character … · vim/vim@6f02b00

attachments.text: …count Problem: Not easy to get mark en cursor posotion by character count. Solution: Add functions that use character index. (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #7648)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/31a11b942a56bf75a653eec0976f365f9b389a5a|patch 8.2.2323: Vim9: error when inferring type from empty dict/list>
patch 8.2.2323: Vim9: error when inferring type from empty dict/list

Problem:    Vim9: error when inferring type from empty dict/list.
Solution:   When the member is t_unknown use t_any. (closes #7009)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2323: Vim9: error when inferring type from empty dict/list · vim/vim@31a11b9
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2323: Vim9: error when inferring type from empty dict/list · vim/vim@31a11b9
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: error when inferring type from empty dict/list. Solution: When the member is t_unknown use t_any. (closes #7009)

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/0186e58639b19933d3d9188d552fe6745265eb1b|patch 8.2.2322: Vim9: closure nested limiting to one level>
patch 8.2.2322: Vim9: closure nested limiting to one level

Problem:    Vim9: closure nested limiting to one level.
Solution:   Add outer_T.  Also make STOREOUTER work.
